intro: Gilia candida f. scariosa, commonly known as the white gilia or white-flowered gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the stems are often covered with a whitish, waxy coating. This variety is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is known for its showy, short-lived blooms.
